headline: Celebrate World Soil Day: The Climate Solution Beneath Our Feet
summary: NORTHAMPTON, MA / ACCESS Newswire / February 9, 2026 / While we often look to the sky for climate solutions - like wind turbines and solar panels - one of the most powerful technologies is right under our feet. This World Soil Day, we celebrate more ...

headline: New Ownership of PostalAnnex in Boca Raton, Florida Brings Fresh Perspective on Serving the Community and Boosting Shipping and Office Services
summary: Annex Brands, Inc., a leading franchisor in the packing, shipping, and office services industries, is pleased to announce the successful transfer of ownership of an existing PostalAnnex location in Boca Raton, FL to new owners, Nestor Abad and Ynes Nero. This transition to new ownership ensures that the community will benefit from the essential shipping and office services provided by this PostalAnnex for the last three years.

headline: Shipping Is the New COGS: Carriers' 2026 Rate Hikes Are Squeezing Ecommerce Margins
summary: As UPS, FedEx, and other major carriers roll out their 2026 rate structures, the ecommerce landscape faces a critical inflection point. With headline General Rate Increases (GRIs) of 5.9% masking effective increases of 10–20% due to surcharges, shipping has ceased to be a simple operational expense. It has evolved into a core component of Cost of Goods Sold (COGS), determining whether online retailers are profitable or merely busy. Ship.com, a leading shipping platform for high-growth brands, to

headline: InPost to return to private hands in $9.3B Advent–FedEx deal
summary: An investor group led by Advent International and FedEx has agreed to buy InPost at a €7.8 billion (about $9.3 billion) valuation in an all-cash deal—bringing the Polish parcel locker operator back into private hands five years after its Amsterdam IPO. Advent and FedEx will pay €15.60 per share for InPost—a 50% premium to its undisturbed trading price. However, the price tag still comes in below the €8 billion valuation the company had secured when it went public in 2021. Advent first acquired t

headline: FedEx Data Push Gains Focus With New Retail Momentum Index
summary: FedEx (NYSE:FDX) and Dun & Bradstreet announced a collaboration to create the Retail Momentum Index. The Index will combine FedEx shipping data with Dun & Bradstreet business data to track U.S. retail activity in real time. The new tool is positioned as an early indicator of retail trends, ahead of traditional government reports. FedEx is best known for its global shipping network. Through FedEx Dataworks it is also building data and analytics services around that core business. The Retail...

headline: FedEx group to buy InPost for European out-of-home parcel network
summary: FedEx has partnered with three investment companies to buy European parcel carrier InPost and take it private, with both sides leveraging complimentary strengths in last-mile delivery and global distribution. The post FedEx group to buy InPost for European out-of-home parcel network appeared first on FreightWaves.

raw.headline: FedEx group to buy InPost for European out-of-home parcel network

The post FedEx group to buy InPost for European out-of-home parcel network appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: Is FedEx (FDX) Quietly Becoming a Data Company Through Its Dun & Bradstreet Partnership?
summary: In early February 2026, Dun & Bradstreet and FedEx Dataworks announced a collaboration to build new data and analytics tools, starting with a Retail Momentum Index that blends shipping, business activity, and government data to give near real-time insight into U.S. retail conditions. By turning previously opaque shipping and supplier relationships into usable intelligence, the partnership aims to give businesses earlier warning of shifts in retail demand and supply chain risk than...

headline: InPost, Advent, FedEx, A&R and PPF Announce Agreement on Recommended All-Cash Offer for All Issued and Outstanding InPost Shares at an Offer Price of EUR 15.60 Per Share
summary: AMSTERDAM & LUXEMBOURG, February 09, 2026--Funds managed and/or advised by Advent International, L.P. and its affiliates ("Advent"), FCWB LLC, a wholly owned subsidiary of FedEx Corporation ("FedEx"), A&R Investments Ltd. headline: Advent, FedEx-Led Consortium to Buy Parcel-Delivery Provider InPost for $9.2 Billion
summary: The consortium will pay €15.60 a share for the Polish parcel-delivery provider, representing a 50% premium to its Jan. 2 share price.
